chunk-eb7f19f6be315673f1966223bad40482.description: Mrs. Norris is a character in the story, associated with the corridor where Harry and Ron discuss the mirror and is also present when they hide under the Cloak.
The Mirror of Erised is an object that shows Harry his deceased family and Ron a vision of himself as Head Boy and Quidditch captain, revealing their deepest desires.

chunk-8f8de2482ce99c7fd198feaf7d316941.description: Gryffindor is a house in the school, competing in the House Championship, with Harry, Ron, Hermione, and Neville as members, and Wood as the Quidditch team captain.
Slytherin is a house in the school, competing against Gryffindor in the House Championship, with a history of being ahead for seven years, and Malfoy as a member.

Dumbledore is a famous wizard mentioned on a Chocolate Frog card that Harry gives to Neville, known for his defeat of Grindelwald, his work with Nicolas Flamel in alchemy, and for discovering the twelve uses of dragon's blood.

chunk-4b80c585d84a141efc3577a7b652f6d0.description: The central character, a player in the game who is under pressure to capture the Snitch and is relieved by Dumbledore's presence. He is also known as 'HARRY POTTER'.
A character who notices Snape's anger and gets into a physical altercation with Malfoy during the game. He is also known as 'RON' and is part of the Weasley family.
A character who is anxious about the game and cheers for Harry, also noticing the fight between Malfoy and Ron.
A character who taunts other characters, particularly Ron and Neville, and gets into a fight with Ron. He is also known as 'MALFOY'.
A character who is taunted by Malfoy but stands up to him, also helping Ron in the fight.
Part of Malfoy's group, laughing at Malfoy's taunts and involved in the scuffle with Neville.
The team that Snape is favoring, receiving penalties against them. Also referred to as 'HUŃEPUĿ'.
The team that Harry, Ron, and Hermione are part of, and they win the game. Also referred to as 'GRYFINDΟΡ'.
The central event in the text where Harry Potter captures the Snitch quickly, leading to Gryffindor's victory.
The broom that Harry Potter uses in the game, contributing to his success in capturing the Snitch. Also referred to as 'NIMBUS TWO THOUSAND'.

chunk-23d93806da9c36811f5748ca10e03166.description: The Weasley twins, known for their mischief, who stole cakes and stuff from the kitchens for the victory party.
A beast owned by Hagrid that guards one of the protections for the Sorcerer's Stone.
The broomstick that Harry uses to follow Snape into the Forbidden Forest.
A location near Hogwarts where Snape and Quirrell have a secret meeting, and a significant place in the events surrounding the Sorcerer's Stone.
The central object of interest in the story, with various characters attempting to protect or steal it, and associated with enchantments and protections including Fluffy.
The location of the door to the room with Fluffy, checked by Harry, Ron, and Hermione to ensure the Sorcerer's Stone's safety.

chunk-1026a83eb32d73b4a41069a81f1ba177.description: Fluffy is the three-headed dog guarding the Sorcerer's Stone, as mentioned in the conversation between the students.
Nicolas Flamel is an old and significant character related to the Sorcerer's Stone, as referenced by Hermione.
The Sorcerer's Stone is the central object of interest in the story, being guarded and sought after by various characters, including Fluffy.
Hagrid is the gamekeeper at Hogwarts who is secretive about what he is hiding and is interested in dragons, as indicated by the books he was looking up.
The Warlocks' Convention of 1709 is the event that led to the outlawing of dragon breeding, as mentioned by Ron.
Dragons mentioned to be present in Britain include the Welsh Green and Hebridean Blacks, which the Ministry of Magic works to keep hidden from Muggles.
The Ministry of Magic is responsible for covering up the existence of dragons in Britain and obliviating Muggles who spot them.

chunk-a8ab5279f35c97b91adf0037c23e3d8d.description: Ravenclaw is one of the houses at Hogwarts, whose students have turned against Harry due to the loss of points.
Hufflepuff is one of the houses at Hogwarts, whose students have also turned against Harry due to the loss of points.
Slytherin is one of the houses at Hogwarts, currently benefiting from Gryffindor's misfortune in the House Cup standings and celebrating the point loss of Gryffindor.
